Pre-Game Insights: Mali have an unbeaten record against Burkina Faso with seven wins and one draw in eight encounters.
Mali have not trailed in any of their AFCON matches so far, while Burkina Faso has not been convincing and faces concerns over their attacking potency and defensive vulnerability.
Mali's form in the tournament includes a 2-0 victory over Bafana Bafana, a 1-1 draw against Tunisia, and a goalless stalemate with Namibia.
Burkina Faso's form includes a 1-0 win over Mauritania, a 2-2 draw with Algeria, and a 2-0 loss to Angola.
Bertrand Traore is expected to start for Burkina Faso, while Lassine Sinayoko is likely to lead the attack for Mali.
Eric Chelle's Burkina Faso side has not been convincing in the tournament so far and faces concerns over their attacking potency and defensive vulnerability.
